intro: Aeschynomene hirta, commonly known as hairy lespedeza, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open woodlands, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink to reddish in color, and it has hairy stems and leaves, giving it its common name. Aeschynomene hirta is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in dry conditions. It is also used in some regions for forage and as a cover crop due to its rapid growth and nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
